meanings.definition: To give a definite structure or form to (something).
meanings.sent1: She structuralized her essay by creating a clear outline before writing.
meanings.sent2: The architect structuralized the building plans to ensure stability and functionality.
meanings.sent3: The chef structuralized the ingredients in a way that made the dish look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His mind structuralized the chaos of thoughts into a coherent plan for the project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher structuralized the classroom rules to make them easy for the students to follow.

meanings.definition: To organize or arrange (something) in a structured manner.
meanings.sent1: He structuralized his schedule to include time for work, exercise, and relaxation.
meanings.sent2: The team structuralized the project tasks to ensure efficient completion.
meanings.sent3: The ants structuralized their march in a way that looked like a well-coordinated dance.
meanings.sent4: Her words structuralized the chaos of emotions swirling inside him.
meanings.sent5: The librarian structuralized the books on the shelves according to genre and author.
